intro: Phyllanthus leptoneurus, commonly known as the slender-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed.
